headline: Targeting Obsolete Dams and Trying to Restore Waterways
abstract: Thousands of dams across New York, many abandoned, are blocking fish migrations. A movement to remove them is growing.
lead_paragraph: NEWBURGH, N.Y. â€” For thousands of years, alewives and blueback herring have left the ocean to swim up the Hudson River to any one of scores of tributaries to lay their eggs. But in a more recent era, the fish have been literally hitting a wall as dams popped up all over the region, powering grist and woolen mills and later factories.
